item.title: Reviewing Peer Review
item.description: I was once asked to a review a paper on classical (digital) superconducting electronics. I’m not really an expert on that kind of thing, but I know enough to be dangerous. After reading the paper I couldn’t detect any obvious flaws. I didn’t have access to their data, so clearly I couldn’t check that they actually got the results they claimed, but I could check consistency between tables and figures, words and figures, and so on.
